Top Skills

relationships

for nontechnical audiencesTsubasa Lin
Business Analytics Professional | Global Experience in Cross
Functional Teams | Bridging Technical and NonTechnical
Audiences | Planning and Administrative Expertise | Passion for
Drawing Business Insights from Data
South Pasadena California United States
Summary
My name is Tsubasa Lin and I am a Business Analytics professional
pursuing a Master’s at the USC Marshall School of Business A
little bit of background about myself I was born in Kobe Japan
however I moved with my family to the San Francisco Bay Area
when I was very young There I did most of my schooling until I
went to UC Davis for my undergrad and obtained a double major in
Economics and Statistics 
From my dual undergraduate degree I developed strong technical
skills in statistics and programming and through my work as a
Transit Planning Assistant for Unitrans I learned how to analyze
realworld data to improve business operations 
I am currently an intern at Scripps Research as a Research
Administration Intern I have learned the ins and outs of research
administration which has improved my domain knowledge in
business and finance 
In the Fall of 2023 I enrolled in the USC Master of Science in
Business Analytics program to work in multicultural and cross
functional teams to make myself even more competitive in the job
market
Within the next two years I hope to eventually work as a business
analyst My current plan is to acquire an analyst internship for the
Summer of 2024
Experience
Scripps Research
Research Administration Intern
  Page 1 of 3    
June 2023  Present  5 months
La Jolla California
 Implement and revise database migration process from financial database
to Workday streamlining administration and business processes for 30
colleagues incorporated creative problemsolving to test and refine migration
 Lead a team of two interns to transfer 200+ ledger accounts to Workday EIB
template in Excel
 Uncovered $500000+ worth of outstanding accounts receivable by
crossreferencing general ledger data and financial accounts for 6 partner
institutions and performing adhoc analysis to recover funds
 Recorded timestamps of 910 research proposal route logs to assess
efficiency of proposal development process
ASUCD Unitrans
2 years 10 months
Transit Planning Assistant
October 2020  July 2023  2 years 10 months
Davis California United States
 Derived operational insights from ridership data by using pivot tables in
Excel wrote reports with graphs based on analyses for 120+ Unitrans workers
and 5 different managers to advocate for potential service change proposals
 Proposed reroute for bus line based on ridership data to improve travel
convenience for 50% of relevant customers
 Developed and promoted a customer satisfaction survey with a finalized
report from 250 customer responses served as a benchmark for future years
with promotion increasing response count by 400% within 3 days
 Led 2 company feedback forums to understand driver concerns promote
a sense of community and unify company behind common goal of providing
safe and reliable transportation service to Davis
 Collected data for analysis by riding bus lines 4 times a week and counting
passengers
 Conduct fieldwork for hazardous tree surveying and the development of new
routes by taking photos and recording field notes
Transit Driver
June 2022  June 2023  1 year 1 month
Davis California United States
 Drove buses that carry 40+ passengers from the UC Davis campus to all
areas of Davis
  Page 2 of 3    
 Managed tasks including driving timing helping passengers and
communicating with the dispatcher 
 Handled highstress situations while being calm and clearheaded to avoid
accidents
University of California Davis
Orientation Leader
April 2020  October 2020  7 months
Davis California United States
 Led a group of 20+ Freshman students through orientation in order for them
to have a smooth transition from high school to college
 Facilitated several meetings every day during orientation week held
teambuilding activities and interacted with students to address any questions/
concerns
Education

Master of Science  MS Business Analytics   August 2023  December 2024
University of California Davis

resume_data:
Contact
www.linkedin.com/in/tsubasanlin
(LinkedIn)
Top Skills
Love to expand partnerships and
relationships
Excellent collaborator
Strength translating technical data
for non-technical audiencesTsubasa Lin
Business Analytics Professional | Global Experience in Cross-
Functional Teams | Bridging Technical and Non-Technical
Audiences | Planning and Administrative Expertise | Passion for
Drawing Business Insights from Data
South Pasadena, California, United States
Summary
My name is Tsubasa Lin and I am a Business Analytics professional
pursuing a Master’s at the USC Marshall School of Business. A
little bit of background about myself— I was born in Kobe, Japan,
however, I moved with my family to the San Francisco Bay Area
when I was very young. There I did most of my schooling until I
went to UC Davis for my undergrad and obtained a double major in
Economics and Statistics. 
From my dual undergraduate degree, I developed strong technical
skills in statistics and programming, and through my work as a
Transit Planning Assistant for Unitrans, I learned how to analyze
real-world data to improve business operations. 
I am currently an intern at Scripps Research as a Research
Administration Intern. I have learned the ins and outs of research
administration, which has improved my domain knowledge in
business and finance. 
In the Fall of 2023, I enrolled in the USC Master of Science in
Business Analytics program to work in multicultural and cross-
functional teams to make myself even more competitive in the job
market.
Within the next two years, I hope to eventually work as a business
analyst. My current plan is to acquire an analyst internship for the
Summer of 2024.
Experience
Scripps Research
Research Administration Intern
  Page 1 of 3    
June 2023 - Present  (5 months)
La Jolla, California
• Implement and revise database migration process from financial database
to Workday, streamlining administration and business processes for 30
colleagues; incorporated creative problem-solving to test and refine migration
• Lead a team of two interns to transfer 200+ ledger accounts to Workday EIB
template in Excel
• Uncovered $500,000+ worth of outstanding accounts receivable by
cross-referencing general ledger data and financial accounts for 6 partner
institutions, and performing ad-hoc analysis to recover funds
• Recorded timestamps of 910 research proposal route logs to assess
efficiency of proposal development process
ASUCD Unitrans
2 years 10 months
Transit Planning Assistant
October 2020 - July 2023  (2 years 10 months)
Davis, California, United States
• Derived operational insights from ridership data by using pivot tables in
Excel; wrote reports with graphs based on analyses for 120+ Unitrans workers
and 5 different managers to advocate for potential service change proposals
• Proposed reroute for bus line based on ridership data to improve travel
convenience for 50% of relevant customers
• Developed and promoted a customer satisfaction survey with a finalized
report from 250 customer responses; served as a benchmark for future years
with promotion increasing response count by 400% within 3 days
• Led 2 company feedback forums to understand driver concerns, promote
a sense of community, and unify company behind common goal of providing
safe and reliable transportation service to Davis
• Collected data for analysis by riding bus lines 4 times a week and counting
passengers
• Conduct fieldwork for hazardous tree surveying, and the development of new
routes by taking photos and recording field notes
Transit Driver
June 2022 - June 2023  (1 year 1 month)
Davis, California, United States
• Drove buses that carry 40+ passengers from the UC Davis campus to all
areas of Davis.
  Page 2 of 3    
• Managed tasks including driving, timing, helping passengers, and
communicating with the dispatcher. 
• Handled high-stress situations while being calm and clearheaded to avoid
accidents.
University of California, Davis
Orientation Leader
April 2020 - October 2020  (7 months)
Davis, California, United States
• Led a group of 20+ Freshman students through orientation in order for them
to have a smooth transition from high school to college
• Facilitated several meetings every day during orientation week, held
teambuilding activities, and interacted with students to address any questions/
concerns
Education
University of Southern California
Master of Science - MS, Business Analytics  · (August 2023 - December 2024)
University of California, Davis
Bachelor's degree, Economics and Statistics  · (2019 - 2023)
Campolindo High School
High School Diploma
